There is no difference between RTM and Retail Channel release. in fact, the retail channel build was compiled a day before the RTM build.

this is the update (Windows8-RT-KB2756872) which was released on 10th Oct 2012 makes it GDR release.

Further, MS has no plan in future to integrate these updates/patches to the windows 8 ISO to make it one like it was done in Windows 7. all patches and updates will be always available on online.
the current version of windows 8 Pro x64 bits after updateds and patches is 9200.16424.amd64fre.win8_gdr.120926-1855
but yes, people are making it one after integrating these updates and patches (customized ISO) using MS Assessment and Deployment Tools.

so either you use RTM or so called retail, makes it no difference.

could you please tell me how to check the build string along with compilation date in win7 & win8 as you mentioned in your comment? I'll be grateful

@SM-003 ,
please open Registry Editor (to open it please type in search 

REGEDIT

works well in both win7 and win8 os.

now just expand the following key in sequence:

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersion
and click the last key CurrentVersion.

now in the right pane please look for the following two ValueName:
BuildLab
BuildLabEx

these two valueName tell you the build and version of your current OS.
here is mine:
http://img837.imageshack.us/img837/7821/11105405.png

@@creative3
dear,

9200.16424.amd64fre.win8_gdr.120926-1855

in the above value the last 10 digits denotes date and time of the build. in the above value 
120926-1855
yymmdd-hhmm
means: 
12 = year 2012
09=  Month September
26= date 26
18= Hours
55= minutes
so this build is compiled on
26th September 2012 at 18 hours 55 minutes.

please remember that this is the date when windows was released for public (you can say it for retail)

but please note that I have installed RTM build which was compiled on 120725-1247 means on 25th July 2012 at 12 hours 47 minutes. but I have installed updates Windows8-RT-KB2756872-x64 and after this the build becomes gdr and shows compiled on 26th September 2012 at 18 hours 55 minutes.

@SM-003,

GDR = General Distribution Release
amd64fre = x64 bits 
RTM = Release to Manufacturer. this copy is released to manufacturer to build their system for sale. 
Retail : this copy is available for general users which is General Distribution Release (GDR)

if you use rtm copy of windows 8 instead of retail copy then it makes no difference as after all online updates it will become retail builds (gdr).
Please note that microsoft did not release any different build of retail copy than RTM. both copies have same build. it just after updates which makes different.

few users have slipstreamed  the updates with RTM copy and uploaded with the name retail copy.

26th Oct 2012 is the date when windows 8 was made available to General users but 26th Sep 2012 (120926-1855) is the date when it was finally compiled and signed off for general public. it is called GDR build date and time and not release time.
do not bother to download so called retail copy. no difference between rtm and retail compiled by MS.
RTM which is also available at MSDN and TEchnet account which is as follows:
File Name: en_windows_8_x64_dvd_915440.iso
Languages: English
SHA1: 1CE53AD5F60419CF04A715CF3233F247E48BEEC4

the above iso includes two windows 8 namely 1. windows 8 core and 2. windows 8 Pro, therefore its size is 4.3 GB for 64 bits if you exclude windows 8 core edition from this ISO to make it only windows 8 pro then its size will become 2.76 GB approx. which is available via MS download on and after 26th Oct 2012 but no difference in build of windows 8 pro for RTM and Retail so far.

I am sorry as I wrongly mentioned the size of windows 8 msdn copy 64 bits 4.3 GB which is not correct. its size is 3.33 GB.
so please read it 3.44 GB.

There is no such thing as an Enterprise retail copy.  They are simply not sold in retail stores.  You are confusing MSDN with Retail stores like most people.

GDR just stands for General Development Release.
LDR stands for Limited Development Release.

Honestly, I've never even seen a LDR release.  GDR controls the kind of hotfixes you download. It does not show any sort of validity of retail.

From the eula I can tell that someone added an ei.cfg, but it also shows that it is an RTM with the RM in the file name.

Anyhow, nice try but Enterprise is not available in retail stores.

If anyone installed (Anti-Virus) and you are seeing a black screen after you log-in. Here is what you need to do to fix that problem:
0: Go to Processes and select one (any) and right click and select Open file location to open explorer and go to control panel and uninstall your anti-virus.
1: Press Ctrl + Alt + Delete 
2: Run Task Manager
3: Select File from top menu and open (Run New Task)
4: Click Browse and Find the crack (Activator) and select and (Right-Click) and Run as Administrator. Y = yes.

After updates are installed you're OS will be deactivated so Run the Activator if so.
